page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = SQL_TableInfoToOpenTable( TableInfo as SQL::TableInfo, Local_File_Name as C )

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: TRUE (.T.) if the operation was successful; otherwise FALSE (.F.).

argument.name: TableInfo
argument.description: A SQL::TableInfo object that records the properties of a table.

argument.name: Local_File_Name
argument.description: The name of the new table to create.

page.description: The SQL_TableInfoToOpenTable() functions creates a new Alpha Anywhere .DBF table based on the specifications in a SQL::TableInfo object.
page.example: dim ti as SQL::tableinfo ? SQL_TableInfoOfDBF("c:\databases\alphasports\product.dbf", ti) = .T. ? SQL_TableInfoToOpenTable(ti, "c:\databases\alphasports\product3.dbf") = .T.
